Dia berdarah Cina- Kanada, saat di kanada dia tinggal di vancouver.Dia memiliki nama asli Wu Yi Fan. dia adalah mantan anggota dari boyband korea bernama EXO, dia keluar dari EXO pada bulan bulan April 2014. It was New Year\u2019s Eve and people all around were merrymaking and celebrating.<br \/>The little girl was sitting beside a fountain in the freezing cold. She was wearing torn and ragged clothes and had no shoes on her feet. No one had bought her matchboxes that (lay and she was frightened to go home because she knew her father would scold tier for coming back without selling anything. She wanted to light a match to keep herself warm but was scared that her father would scold her for wasting a matchstick. Finally, unable to bear the cold anymore. she took out one matchstick and lit it. Lo! She was sitting in front of a warn) stove. She reached out her hands to feel the heart but the fire soon died out. Then she lit another match and saw a din-[let table with a roast goose on it. She chuckled in delight but after a while. this match also died out. She looked up at the sky and saw a falling star. tier grandmother used to say, \u201cA falling star is a soul that has reached the sky.\u201d When she Struck another match she saw her grandmother.<br \/>That night, she burnt all her matchsticks. wishing to keep tier grandmother with her. No one would ever know the wonderful dreams she had had, the previous night.<br \/>Text 2<br \/>A beautiful Paper Kite was flying high in the sky. It was brightly coloured, with long, curly tassels and a long string.<br \/>The Paper Kite was so high up, above all the trees and other kites, that it was giddy with excitement. Admiring itself, it said loudly, \u201cLook at me flying so gracefully! If I were free, I could go far away.\u201d<br \/>The Paper Kite tugged at its string, as it wanted to fly right through the clouds and above the eagles. However, the string was strong and held it tight.<br \/>The Paper Kite impatiently tugged at its string again, and the string broke.<br \/>The Paper Kite was full of joy. It tried to fly higher but suddenly, it started falling. The Paper Kite tried with all its might to stay up, but it kept coming down. Free of its string, the Paper Kite had become too heavy and could not control itself. It drifted towards the sea and was washed away in the tide.<br \/>The Paper Kite cried, \u201cO poor me! I wanted to fly higher and higher. She was wearing torn and ragged clothes and had no shoes on her feet. No one had bought her matchboxes that (lay and she was frightened to go home because she knew her father would scold tier for coming back without selling anything. She wanted to light a match to keep herself warm but was scared that her father would scold her for wasting a matchstick. Finally, unable to bear the cold anymore. she took out one matchstick and lit it. Lo! She was sitting in front of a warn) stove. She reached out her hands to feel the heart but the fire soon died out. Then she lit another match and saw a din-[let table with a roast goose on it. She chuckled in delight but after a while. this match also died out. She looked up at the sky and saw a falling star. tier grandmother used to say, \u201cA falling star is a soul that has reached the sky.\u201d When she Struck another match she saw her grandmother.That night, she burnt all her matchsticks. wishing to keep tier grandmother with her. It tried to fly higher but suddenly, it started falling. The Paper Kite tried with all its might to stay up, but it kept coming down. Free of its string, the Paper Kite had become too heavy and could not control itself. It drifted towards the sea and was washed away in the tide.The Paper Kite cried, \u201c<em>O<\/em> poor me! She does her homework every day. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>      (-) \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>      (?)\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.&lt;br \/&gt;&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>Fill in the blanks with PRESENT CONTINUOUS or SIMPLE PRESENT:&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>E.G.            1. (play) outside now.&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>                        The children are playing outside now.&lt;br \/&gt;&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>                    2. She usually \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. (read) the newspaper in the morning. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>                        She usually reads the newspaper in the morning.&lt;br \/&gt;&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>3. I \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026 (do) my homework now. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>4. I \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026 (eat) my dinner now.&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>5. \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. (you \/ want) a pizza? &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>6. They \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.. (watch) TV now.&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>7. I \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. (not \/ like) spaghetti. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>8. The baby \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. (sleep) now. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>9. My mother usually \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. (cook) dinner in the evening. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>10. He \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.. (write) a letter to his pen-friend every month.&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>11. She \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. (not \/ like) football. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>12. Mary \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.. (listen) to music now. &lt;br \/&gt;&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>Write DON\u2019T, DOESN\u2019T, ISN\u2019T, AREN\u2019T or AM NOT in the blank space in each sentence: &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>E.G.      a. He _______ listening to the radio right now. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>                 He isn\u2019t listening to the radio right now.&lt;br \/&gt;&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>              b. He _______  listen to the radio every evening. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>                  He doesn\u2019t listen to the radio every evening. &lt;br \/&gt;&lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>c. We \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. watching a television program now. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>d. Mum is making \/ makes a cake. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>5. Our teacher is giving \/ gives us a test every month. &lt;br \/&gt;<br \/>6. Listen!                             "ptsForBest": 3
                        },
                        "content": "Unit 13 \u2013 revision exercises, Simple Past<br \/><br \/>\nT 13.6 \u2013 Fill in with Simple Past form of the verb: Noises in the night<br \/>\nIt _________ (be) about two o\u2019clock in the morning, and \u2026 suddenly I __________ (wake) up. I _________ (hear) a noise. I ________ (get) out of bed and __________(go) slowly downstairs. There ____________ (be) a light on in the living room. I _____________ (listen) carefully. I could hear two men speaking very quietly. \u2018Burglars!\u2019 I ___________ (think). \u2018Two burglars!\u2019 Immediately I _________ (run) back upstairs and ________(phone) the police. I _________(be) really frightened. Fortunately the police ____________(arrive) quickly. They _______________(open) the front door and __________(go) into the living room. Then they _____________(come) upstairs to find me. \u2018It\u2019s all right now, sir,\u2019 they _____________(explain). \u2018We _______________(turn) the television off for you!\u2019<br \/>\nT 13.7<br \/>\nOne dollar and eighty\u2013seven cents. That __________(be) all. Della carefully ______________(count) the money again. There __________(be) no mistake. Every day, when she ________(go) to the shops, she didn't spend much money. She ____________(buy) the cheapest meat and the cheapest vegetables. It ________(be) very tiring \u2014 she ___________(walk) for hours around the shops to find the cheapest food. She ___________(save) every cent possible. Only one dollar and eighty\u2013seven cents. The next day was Christmas, and she couldn't do anything about it. So she __________ (sit) there in her little room and __________(cry) quietly.<br \/>\nDella _____________(live) in this poor little room in New York with her husband, James Dillingham Young. James (Jim to his friends) _________(be) lucky because he _________(have) a job, but it wasn't a good job. Times _________(be) bad and there was no work for Della. But when Jim ___________(come) home, she immediately __________(put) her arms around him. And that __________(be) good. Della ______________(want) to buy him a Christmas present \u2014 something really good to show how much she ___________(love) him. Suddenly she __________(run) to the mirror and __________(look) at her beautiful long hair. Then she _________(put) on her old brown hat and coat and quickly _________(go) into town.<br \/>\nT 13.8<br \/>\nShe ______________(stop) when she ____________(come) to a door with 'Madame Eloise \u2014 Hair' on it. Inside ____( be) a small fat woman. 'Do you buy hair?' Della ________(ask). 'I buy hair', Madame __________(answer). 'Take your hat off, then, and show me your hair.' Madame slowly ______________(touch) the hair with her hand. 'Twenty dollars', she ________(say) . 'Quick! Cut it off! Give me the money!' Della _________(say). The next two hours ________(go) quickly. Della ________(be) happy, because she _______(be) at the shops with money for a present for Jim. At last she ________(find) him the perfect present. Jim ________(have) one special thing. He ________(have) a beautiful gold watch that once _____________(belong) to his father, and before that to his grandfather. Jim __________(love) his watch, but it _________(have) no chain. When Della __________(see)  the gold watch chain, she _________(know) immediately that it ________(be) right for Jim. It ________(cost)  twenty\u2013one dollars. Della ________(run) home excitedly with the eighty\u2013seven cents. When she __________(arrive), she _________(look) at her very short hair in the mirror. 'Oh dear. I look like a schoolboy! What is Jim going to say when he sees me?' At seven o'clock Jim ___________(come) in. His eyes _________(be)  on Della. She could not understand the look on his face. He _________(be) not angry or surprised. He just ___________(look) at her sadly. Della ________(run) to him. 'Jim, don't look at me like that! I _________(sell) my hair because I ___________(want) to give you a present.' 'You ____________(sell) your hair?' he _________(say) quietly.'Yes, I ___________(tell) you. But don't worry. It grows so fast. But don't you love me anymore, Jim?'<br \/>\nT 13.9<br \/>\nSuddenly Jim _________(put) his arms around Della. 'I love you, Della. It doesn't matter if your hair is long or short. But open this. Then you can see why I _______(be) unhappy at first.' Della ___________(open) the present excitedly. Then she ___________(give) a little scream of happiness. But a second later there was a cry of unhappiness. There _________(be) the combs \u2014 for her beautiful hair. I _________ (hear) a noise. I ________ (get) out of bed and __________(go) slowly downstairs. There ____________ (be) a light on in the living room. I _____________ (listen) carefully. I could hear two men speaking very quietly. \u2018Burglars!\u2019 I ___________ (think). \u2018Two burglars!\u2019 Immediately I _________ (run) back upstairs and ________(phone) the police. I _________(be) really frightened. Fortunately the police ____________(arrive) quickly. They _______________(open) the front door and __________(go) into the living room. Then they _____________(come) upstairs to find me. \u2018It\u2019s all right now, sir,\u2019 they _____________(explain). \u2018We _______________(turn) the television off for you!\u2019\nT 13.7\nOne dollar and eighty\u2013seven cents. That __________(be) all. Della carefully ______________(count) the money again. There __________(be) no mistake. Every day, when she ________(go) to the shops, she didn't spend much money. She ____________(buy) the cheapest meat and the cheapest vegetables. It ________(be) very tiring \u2014 she ___________(walk) for hours around the shops to find the cheapest food. She ___________(save) every cent possible. Only one dollar and eighty\u2013seven cents. The next day was Christmas, and she couldn't do anything about it. So she __________ (sit) there in her little room and __________(cry) quietly.\nDella _____________(live) in this poor little room in New York with her husband, James Dillingham Young. James (Jim to his friends) _________(be) lucky because he _________(have) a job, but it wasn't a good job. Times _________(be) bad and there was no work for Della. But when Jim ___________(come) home, she immediately __________(put) her arms around him. And that __________(be) good. Della ______________(want) to buy him a Christmas present \u2014 something really good to show how much she ___________(love) him. Suddenly she __________(run) to the mirror and __________(look) at her beautiful long hair. Then she _________(put) on her old brown hat and coat and quickly _________(go) into town.\nT 13.8\nShe ______________(stop) when she ____________(come) to a door with 'Madame Eloise \u2014 Hair' on it. Inside ____( be) a small fat woman. 'Do you buy hair?' Della ________(ask). 'I buy hair', Madame __________(answer). 'Take your hat off, then, and show me your hair.' Madame slowly ______________(touch) the hair with her hand. 'Twenty dollars', she ________(say) . 'Quick! Cut it off! Give me the money!' Della _________(say). The next two hours ________(go) quickly. Della ________(be) happy, because she _______(be) at the shops with money for a present for Jim. At last she ________(find) him the perfect present.                         "content": "Tolong di jwb dhong pertanyaan dri cerita ini:<br \/>\n                 Gecko\u2019s Complaint<br \/>\nOne night a village Chief was awakened out of a deep sleep by fi ve calls of \u201cGeck-o, Geck-o, <br \/>\nGeck-o, Geck-o, Geck-o.\u201d It was, of course, Gecko, the Lizard, and he wanted to see the Chief, a wise <br \/>\nand kind man, who received him with pleasure, even though it was the middle of the night.<br \/>\n Gecko had come to lodge a complaint. He was very disturbed and unhappy, he said.<br \/>\n To the rest of God\u2019s creatures, it might have seemed that Gecko ought to have no reason at <br \/>\nall to complain. He could do so many things that other creatures could not, such as walk on the <br \/>\nwall, or upside down on the ceiling. He could do this because he had little pads on the tip of each <br \/>\nof his toes. Not only that, if his tail should be lost in a battle with another lizard, he would be able <br \/>\nto grow another one, just as good as, if not better than, the old one. His smaller cousin, Cicak, <br \/>\nwas much more active and mobile, darting across the wall as he chased his mate, sometimes <br \/>\nstopping for a short climb up a sideboard to sample some sweet or other, while Gecko expended <br \/>\na minimum of energy, sitting lazily up in the rafters, going out at night in search of mosquitoes, <br \/>\nfi lling the night with his raucous calls. What would Gecko ever have to complain about?<br \/>\nBut now Gecko was upset. For several weeks he had not been able to sleep because of Firefl y. <br \/>\nNight after night the black lightning beetle with red and yellow spots fl ew around and about him, <br \/>\nglowing like sparks of fi re, fl ashing his light into Gecko\u2019s eyes.<br \/>\nThe Chief, who really did not like his sleep to be disturbed either, was sympathetic, and <br \/>\npromised to make an investigation. He asked Gecko to come back to see him in a week or so.<br \/>\nThe next day the Chief called Firefl y and told him about Gecko\u2019 complaint. \u201cIs it only Gecko <br \/>\nyou are disturbing?\u201d he asked, \u201cor is it possible that others are also bothered by your light fl ash-<br \/>\ning into their eyes?\u201dFirefl y\u2019 light was out now, as he spoke very humbly to the Chief. \u201cI meant no harm, sir. In <br \/>\nfact, I thought I was doing something good. I heard the drumming of Woodpecker as he struck <br \/>\nhis bill on the tree trunk, and I thought it was a kulkul calling villagers to get up and gather. I was <br \/>\nonly fl ashing my light to pass on the message.\u201d<br \/>\n The Chief then decided to ask Woodpecker about this. He found him and told him what <br \/>\nFirefl y had said.<br \/>\n \u201cI too was only passing on a warning, sir,\u201d said Woodpecker. \u201cI heard the kwak-kwak-kwak <br \/>\nof Frog in the rice paddies, and I thought it was a warning that an earthquake was coming. So I <br \/>\njust passed on the message.\u201d<br \/>\n Now the chief went in search of Frog, who meanwhile had heard that he would be inter-<br \/>\nrogated. \u201cThe reason I was kwak-kwak-kwaking more and louder than usual,\u201d he explained, \u201cis <br \/>\nthat I saw Black Beetle walking down the road carrying fi lth, which I thought was so dirty and so <br \/>\nunhygienic that I had to stop him.\u201d<br \/>\n \u201cThat is indeed bad,\u201d thought the Chief. \u201cI must speak to Beetle at once.\u201d<br \/>\n Black Beetle, plump and gleaming like polished copper, was also very humble and respect-<br \/>\nful, as he explained the situation.<br \/>\n \u201cYou see, sir, Water Buffalo comes by dropping his pat in the middle of the road, and I just <br \/>\nthought it was my duty to clean it up.\u201d<br \/>\n The Chief was now beginning to lose patience. \u201cTell Water Buffalo I wish to see him!\u201d he <br \/>\nordered.<br \/>\n When Water Buffalo appeared, he was polite, but he expressed his displeasure with Beetle\u2019s <br \/>\nreport.<br \/>\n \u201cIt is clear,\u201d he said, \u201cthat I am not appreciated. Rain washes away all the stones in the road, <br \/>\nand I fi ll up the holes. Who else does that, I ask you?\u201d<br \/>\n By this time the Village Chief was tired, but he had to hear Rain\u2019s story. And Rain was angry.<br \/>\n\u201cComplaining about ME?\u201d he asked. \u201cWho asks the gods for Rain, even makes offerings to them <br \/>\nso they will send Rain? Without ME there are no mosquitoes, and if there are no mosquitoes, Gecko <br \/>\nis hungry and unhappy. Don\u2019t speak to me. Speak to Gecko!\u201d<br \/>\nWhen Gecko returned to the home of the Chief as he had been requested to do, the Chief spoke <br \/>\nto him very sternly indeed.<br \/>\n\u201cGecko, say no more. We all have our problems. Go home, and live at peace with all your neigh-<br \/>\nbours!\u201d<br \/>\nAdapted from Alibasah, 1999.<br \/>\nQuestions <br \/>\n1. Who are the main characters of the story?<br \/>\n2. Why did Gecko want to see the Chief?<br \/>\n3. Why was Gecko unable to sleep for several weeks?<br \/>\n4. Not only that, if his tail should be lost in a battle with another lizard, he would be able \nto grow another one, just as good as, if not better than, the old one.                         "content": "Question number 6 to 10 is based on the following text.<br \/><br \/>It was the night of the fair, and the children at Muhammad taufik\u2019s school were really excited. They ran down the path out of school as fast as they could. Muhammad taufik ran all the way home, and changed into his jeans and sneakers. He ate his dinner quickly, and sat at the window waiting for his dad to come home. He couldn\u2019t wait for six o\u2019clock when the fair would begin. He had been saving his pocket money for weeks.<br \/><br \/>When Muhammad taufik and his family arrived at the fair, it had just opened. Already there were crowds of people swarming around footstalls, displays and dozens of rides. \u201cCan I buy some chips and a drink?\u201d asked MUhammad Taufik.<br \/>\u201cOkay,\u201d said Muhammad taufik\u2019s dad. \u201cBut hang on tightly to your wallet, there\u2019s a lot of people around.\u201d \u201cI\u2019ll be fine,\u201d said Muhammad taufik impatiently.<br \/><br \/>He found a footstall, and ordered his food. When the man brought his chips and drink, without thinking, MUhammad Taufik put his wallet on the counter and picked up his food and drink. When he glanced back, his wallet had vanished! MUhammad Taufik desperately looked around him, but it was no use. If only he\u2019d listened to his dad. All his pocket money was gone.<br \/><br \/>Soal\u00a06<br \/><br \/>hat does the text talk about?<br \/><br \/>Pilih jawabanmu.<br \/><br \/>1The nice dinner for Muhammad taufik with his family<br \/>.2The excited traveling for Muhammad taufik in the fair<br \/>.3The good chip and drink for Muhammad taufik in the fair<br \/>.4The excited fair experience for Muhammad taufik in the fair.<br \/>5The unpleasant experience for Muhammad taufik in the fair.<br \/><br \/>Soal\u00a07<br \/><br \/>How is the situation in the fair that night?<br \/><br \/>Pilih jawabanmu.<br \/><br \/>1Many people displayed the dozens of rides.<br \/>2Many people bought some chips and drink.<br \/>3There was the man brought his chips and drink.<br \/>4Many people swarmed around footstalls.<br \/>5There were crowds of people riding some horses.<br \/><br \/>Soal\u00a08<br \/><br \/>What did Muhammad taufik do before going to the fair?<br \/><br \/>Pilih jawabanmu.<br \/><br \/>1He was waiting for his dad at the window.<br \/>2He came home very late.<br \/>3He ran all way to the fair<br \/>4He changed into his jeans and bag.<br \/>5He ate his dinner with his family<br \/><br \/>Soal\u00a09<br \/><br \/>What happened with Muhammad taufik\u2019s wallet in the fair?<br \/><br \/>Pilih jawabanmu.<br \/><br \/>1It was used to buy his food and drink.<br \/>2It was put on the counter carefully.<br \/>3It was given by his father in his birthday.<br \/>4It was used to save his pocket money for weeks.<br \/>5It might be taken by other person<br \/><br \/>Soal\u00a010<br \/><br \/>\u201c\u2026his wallet had vanished!\u201d (last paragraph). Which sentences\/questions are correct?<br \/><br \/>\n1) Which sentence is in the Simple Present? <br \/>\na)He can a bike ride. <br \/>\nb)He can ride a bike. <br \/>\nc)He can rides a bike. <br \/>\nd)He cans ride a bike. <br \/><br \/>\n2) Which sentence is in the Simple Present? <br \/>\na)He has read a book. <br \/>\nb)He is reading a book. <br \/>\nc)He read a book. <br \/>\nd)He reads a book. <br \/>\ne)He will read a book. <br \/><br \/>\n3) Which negative sentence is in the Simple Present? <br \/>\na)He do not reads a book. <br \/>\nb)He does not read a book. <br \/>\nc)He is not reading a book. <br \/>\nd)He not read a book. <br \/><br \/>\n4) Which negative sentence is in the Simple Present? <br \/>\na)We do'nt work in a bank. <br \/>\nb)We does not work in a bank. <br \/>\nc)We don't work in a bank. <br \/><br \/>\n5) Which question is in the Simple Present? <br \/>\na)Do she work in an office? <br \/>\nb)Do she works in an office? <br \/>\nc)Does she work in an office? <br \/>\nd)Work she in an office? <br \/>\ne)Works she in an office? <br \/><br \/>\n6) Which question is in the Simple Present? <br \/>\na)From where do you come? <br \/>\nb)Where do you come from? <br \/>\nc)Where does you come from? <br \/>\nd)Where dos you come from? <br \/><br \/>\n7) In which sentence is the Simple Present used correctly? <br \/>\na)Carol clean the bathroom. <br \/>\nb)Carol cleans the bathroom. <br \/><br \/>\n8) In which sentence is the Simple Present used correctly? <br \/>\na)Andrew wash the dishes. <br \/>\nb)Andrew washes the dishes. <br \/>\nc)Andrew washs the dishes. <br \/><br \/>\nC - Form questions in the Simple Present.<br \/><br \/>\n1) Frank \/ to read \/ comics ______________________________________ <br \/><br \/>\n2) what \/ they \/ to eat \/ for breakfast ______________________________________ <br \/>\n3) when \/ his mum \/ to come \/ home ______________________________________ <br \/>\n4) to be \/ Peter \/ from Austria ______________________________________ <br \/><br \/>\n5) Marie and Joe \/ to like \/ homework ______________________________________ <br \/>\n6) you \/ to walk \/ to school ______________________________________ <br \/><br \/>\n7) where \/ she \/ to live ______________________________________ <br \/><br \/>\n8) why \/ you \/ to ride \/ your bike ______________________________________ <br \/><br \/>\n9) how \/ Linda \/ to go \/ to the park ______________________________________ <br \/>\n10) can \/ Ron \/ to speak \/ English ______________________________________ <br \/><br \/>\nD - Put in the verbs in brackets into the gaps. <br \/><br \/>\n1) Jill ____________________ two children. (to have)<br \/><br \/>\n2) The pupils ____________________ songs in the classroom. (to sing)<br \/><br \/>\n3) Andy's brother ____________________ in an office. (to work)<br \/><br \/>\n4) She ____________________ my sister. (to be)<br \/><br \/>\n5) ____________________ you ____________________ English?                         "content": "Tolong berikan generic structurenyaa !!<br \/>\nsingkat saja tak aoa<br \/><br \/>\nOne day, there was an old woman who lived alone. She was very sad over her fate. The old woman continued to hope and pray that she wanted a child.<br \/><br \/>\n Then a little fairy heard the old woman\u2019s prayer. She came to the old woman, \u201cWhy do you want a child?\u201d asked the elf. The old woman was surprised by the arrival of the fairies. \u201cI would be very happy if I have a small child\u201d replied the old woman. Hearing that answer, the fairy gave her a flower seed. \u201cPlant these seeds in a flower pot!\u201d the fairy Commanded. \u201cThank you for your kindness!\u201d She replied. After giving her the seed, the fairy left her alone.<br \/><br \/>\nShe planted the seed immediately after the fairy left. She always took care of the seed till grow into a beautiful flowering plants. When the flowers bloomed, she saw a little girl in it. The girl was very small even its size almost equal to the size of her thumb. The old lady was very pleased and gave her the name of Thumbelina. <br \/><br \/>\nAfterwards she made Thumbelina a bed from the shells and dried leaves as a blanket.<br \/>\nOn one night, as she lay in his bed, a big ugly frog came to her. The toad crept through a broken glass of window. \u201cO beautiful girl! Will you be my son\u2019s wife?\u201d said the frog. Then the frog carried the shells along with Thumbelina who was sleeping in it. Then she jumped through the window into the garden.<br \/><br \/>\nThumbelina was taken by frog to a flower garden. The toad lived with her son even worse than his mother. Her children was shocked to see what her mom brought, \u201ckrook Krokk what did you bring mom?\u201d, \u201cI brought a girl to be your wife!\u201d His mother answered. Then her children felt in love with Thumbelina. When Thumbelina woke up, she was surprised she was not at home. \u201cWhere I am, who are you?\u201d Thumbelina asked. \u201cYou will be my wife korokk Krook!\u201d The frog said. Thumbelina felt very sad and she begged to be released but the frog rejected. When the frog was asleep, she run away to escape.<br \/><br \/>\nThumbelina feel sad. She cried along a snowy road. When she was crying, a swallow came to her. \u201cWhy are you sad?\u201d The swallow asked. \u201cI had been kidnapped and did not know where to go\u201d said Thumbelina. The bird felt sad to see what Thumbelina suffer. Then he helped Thumbelina, \u201ccome along with me to my country, there is warmer than here\u201d invite swallow. Thumbelina was willing to go with him. Thumbelina then climbed up to swallow\u2019s body. After that, he took Thumbelina away to the place of his origins.<br \/><br \/>\nThey flew across the ocean. And then they arrived in a warm area. The swallow said, \u201cThis is my house. You can stay in one of the largest and most beautiful flowers in this place.\u201d When Thumbelina entered the house, she found a small handsome elf. He is the son of the king of flowers. The little elf fell in love with Thumbelina. He asked her to marry him. Thumbelina eventually become queen of flowers and they lived happily ever after.<br \/><br \/>",

The old woman continued to hope and pray that she wanted a <em>chil<\/em>d.\n Then a little fairy heard the old woman\u2019s prayer. She came to the old woman, \u201cWhy do you want a <em>chil<\/em>d?\u201d asked the elf. The old woman was surprised by the arrival of the fairies. \u201cI would be very happy if I have a small <em>chil<\/em>d\u201d replied the old woman. Hearing that answer, the fairy gave her a flower seed. \u201cPlant these seeds in a flower pot!\u201d the fairy Commanded. \u201cThank you for your kindness!\u201d She replied. After giving her the seed, the fairy left her alone.\nShe planted the seed immediately after the fairy left. She always took care of the seed till grow into a beautiful flowering plants. When the flowers bloomed, she saw a little girl in it. The girl was very small even its size almost equal to the size of her thumb. The old lady was very pleased and gave her the name of Thumbelina. \nAfterwards she made Thumbelina a bed from the shells and dried leaves as a blanket.\nOn one night, as she lay in his bed, a big ugly frog came to her. The toad crept through a broken glass of window. \u201c<em>O<\/em> beautiful girl! Will you be my son\u2019s wife?\u201d said the frog. Then the frog carried the shells along with Thumbelina who was sleeping in it. Then she jumped through the window into the garden.\nThumbelina was taken by frog to a flower garden. The toad lived with her son even worse than his mother. Her <em>chil<\/em>dren was shocked to see what her mom brought, \u201ckrook Krokk what did you bring mom?\u201d, \u201cI brought a girl to be your wife!\u201d His mother answered. Then her <em>chil<\/em>dren felt in love with Thumbelina. When Thumbelina woke up, she was surprised she was not at home. \u201cWhere I am, who are you?\u201d Thumbelina asked. \u201cYou will be my wife korokk Krook!\u201d The frog said. Thumbelina felt very sad and she begged to be released but the frog rejected. When the frog was asleep, she run away to escape.\nThumbelina feel sad. She cried along a snowy road. When she was crying, a swallow came to her. \u201cWhy are you sad?\u201d The swallow asked. \u201cI had been kidnapped and did not know where to go\u201d said Thumbelina. The bird felt sad to see what Thumbelina suffer. Then he helped Thumbelina, \u201ccome along with me to my country, there is warmer than here\u201d invite swallow. Thumbelina was willing to go with him. Thumbelina then climbed up to swallow\u2019s body. After that, he took Thumbelina away to the place of his origins.\nThey flew across the ocean. And then they arrived in a warm area. The swallow said, \u201cThis is my house. You can stay in one of the largest and most beautiful flowers in this place.\u201d When Thumbelina entered the house, she found a small handsome elf. He is the son of the king of flowers. The little elf fell in love with Thumbelina. He asked her to marry him. Thumbelina eventually become queen of flowers and they lived happily ever after.",

                            "content": "*ORIENTATION<br \/>          One day, there was an old woman who lived alone. She was very sad over her fate. The old woman continued to hope and pray that she wanted a child.<br \/><br \/>*COMPLICATION<br \/>         Then a little fairy heard the old woman\u2019s prayer. She came to the old woman, \u201cWhy do you want a child?\u201d asked the elf. The old woman was surprised by the arrival of the fairies. \u201cI would be very happy if I have a small child\u201d replied the old woman. Hearing that answer, the fairy gave her a flower seed. \u201cPlant these seeds in a flower pot!\u201d the fairy Commanded. \u201cThank you for your kindness!\u201d She replied. After giving her the seed, the fairy left her alone.<br \/>She planted the seed immediately after the fairy left. She always took care of the seed till grow into a beautiful flowering plants. When the flowers bloomed, she saw a little girl in it. The girl was very small even its size almost equal to the size of her thumb. The old lady was very pleased and gave her the name of Thumbelina. <br \/>Afterwards she made Thumbelina a bed from the shells and dried leaves as a blanket.<br \/>On one night, as she lay in his bed, a big ugly frog came to her. The toad crept through a broken glass of window. \u201cO beautiful girl! Will you be my son\u2019s wife?\u201d said the frog. Then the frog carried the shells along with Thumbelina who was sleeping in it. Then she jumped through the window into the garden.<br \/>Thumbelina was taken by frog to a flower garden. The toad lived with her son even worse than his mother. Her children was shocked to see what her mom brought, \u201ckrook Krokk what did you bring mom?\u201d, \u201cI brought a girl to be your wife!\u201d His mother answered. Then her children felt in love with Thumbelina. When Thumbelina woke up, she was surprised she was not at home. \u201cWhere I am, who are you?\u201d Thumbelina asked. \u201cYou will be my wife korokk Krook!\u201d The frog said. Thumbelina felt very sad and she begged to be released but the frog rejected. When the frog was asleep, she run away to escape.<br \/>Thumbelina feel sad. She cried along a snowy road. When she was crying, a swallow came to her. \u201cWhy are you sad?\u201d The swallow asked. \u201cI had been kidnapped and did not know where to go\u201d said Thumbelina. The bird felt sad to see what Thumbelina suffer. Then he helped Thumbelina, \u201ccome along with me to my country, there is warmer than here\u201d invite swallow. Thumbelina was willing to go with him. Thumbelina then climbed up to swallow\u2019s body. After that, he took Thumbelina away to the place of his origins.<br \/><br \/>*RESOLUTION<br \/>           They flew across the ocean. And then they arrived in a warm area. The swallow said, \u201cThis is my house. You can stay in one of the largest and most beautiful flowers in this place.\u201d When Thumbelina entered the house, she found a small handsome elf. He is the son of the king of flowers. The little elf fell in love with Thumbelina. He asked her to marry him. <br \/><br \/>*RE-ORIENTATION<br \/>         Thumbelina eventually become queen of flowers and they lived happily ever after.<br \/><br \/><br \/>#GoodLuck",

Mereka terlibat dalam pahit<br \/>\nperseteruan. Di antara Montague adalah Romeo,<br \/>\nseorang pemuda berdarah panas dengan mata<br \/>\nuntuk wanita. Suatu hari, Romeo dihadiri hari<br \/>\nraya Capulets ', kostum pesta di mana ia<br \/>\nberharap untuk bertemu nya cinta, Rosaline,<br \/>\nkecantikan angkuh dari baik-untuk-melakukan<br \/>\nkeluarga. Sesampai di sana, bagaimanapun, Mata<br \/>\nRomeo Juliet merasa atas, dan dia memikirkan<br \/>\nRosaline tidak lebih. Visi Juliet telah menyerang<br \/>\nsetiap pemikirannya. Tidak bisa tidur, Romeo<br \/>\nkembali larut malam itu untuk Jendela kamar<br \/>\ntidur Juliet. Di sana, ia terkejut menemukan Juliet<br \/>\ndi balkon, mengaku cintanya dan berharap bahwa<br \/>\ndia bukan seorang \"Montague\", nama balik<br \/>\nsendiri. \"Apa arti sebuah nama? Itu yang kita<br \/>\nsebut mawar dengan yang lain Nama akan bau<br \/>\nmanis. \"Romeo adalah siap untuk menyangkal<br \/>\nnamanya dan mengaku cintanya. Keduanya<br \/>\nsepakat untuk bertemu di sembilan o-jam<br \/>\nkeesokan harinya untuk menikah. Keesokan<br \/>\npaginya, Romeo datang ke Friar Lawrence<br \/>\nmengemis biarawan untuk menikahkannya dengan<br \/>\nJuliet. The Friar dilakukan upacara, berdoa bahwa<br \/>\nserikat mungkin suatu hari nanti mengakhiri<br \/>\npermusuhan antara dua keluarga. Dia<br \/>\nmenyarankan Romeo terus pernikahan rahasia<br \/>\nuntuk waktu. Dalam perjalanan pulang, Romeo<br \/>\nkebetulan pada temannya Mercutio berdebat<br \/>\ndengan Tybalt, anggota dari klan Capulet. Bahwa<br \/>\nqurreling lalu menyebabkan Merquito meninggal.<br \/>\nRomeo enggan lagi. Dia menarik pedangnya dan<br \/>\nmembunuh Tybalt meninggal. Romeo menyadari<br \/>\nbahwa ia telah membuat kesalahan besar.<br \/>\nKemudian Friar Lawrence menyarankan Romeo ke<br \/>\nperjalanan ke Mantua sampai keadaan dingin. Dia<br \/>\nberjanji untuk menginformasikan Juliet. Di sisi<br \/>\nlain, ayah Juliet telah memutuskan waktu baginya<br \/>\nuntuk menikah dengan Paris. Juliet berkonsultasi<br \/>\nFriar Lawrence dan membuat sebuah rencana<br \/>\nuntuk mengambil tidur yang ramuan untuk Juliet<br \/>\nyang akan mensimulasikan kematian selama tiga<br \/>\nhari. Plot melanjutkan menurut rencana. Juliet<br \/>\ntidur dalam kematian. Sayangnya, Surat Friar<br \/>\ngagal mencapai Romeo. Di bawah sampul<br \/>\nkegelapan, ia masuk ke makam Juliet. Romeo<br \/>\nmencium bibir satu Juliet-nya terakhir kali dan<br \/>\nminum racun. Sementara itu, efek dari tidur yang<br \/>\nramuan luntur. Juliet bangun menelepon untuk<br \/>\nRomeo. Dia menemukan cintanya di samping ,<br \/>\ntapi tergeletak mati, dengan secangkir racun di<br \/>\ntangannya. Dia mencoba untuk mencium<br \/>\nmeracuni dari bibirnya, tapi gagal. Mereka terlibat dalam pahit\nperseteruan. Di antara Montague adalah Romeo,\nseorang pemuda berdarah panas dengan mata\nuntuk wanita. Di sana, ia terkejut menemukan Juliet\ndi balkon, mengaku <em>cin<\/em>tanya dan berharap bahwa\ndia bukan seorang \"Montague\", nama balik\nsendiri. \"Apa arti sebuah nama? Itu yang kita\nsebut mawar dengan yang lain Nama akan bau\nmanis. \"Romeo adalah siap untuk menyangkal\nnamanya dan mengaku <em>cin<\/em>tanya. Keduanya\nsepakat untuk bertemu di sembilan <em>o<\/em>-jam\nkeesokan harinya untuk menikah. Keesokan\npaginya, Romeo datang ke Friar Lawrence\nmengemis biarawan untuk menikahkannya dengan\nJuliet. The Friar dilakukan upacara, berdoa bahwa\nserikat mungkin suatu hari nanti mengakhiri\npermusuhan antara dua keluarga. Dia\nmenyarankan Romeo terus pernikahan rahasia\nuntuk waktu. Dalam perjalanan pulang, Romeo\nkebetulan pada temannya Mercutio berdebat\ndengan Tybalt, anggota dari klan Capulet. Bahwa\nqurreling lalu menyebabkan Merquito meninggal.\nRomeo enggan lagi. Dia menarik pedangnya dan\nmembunuh Tybalt meninggal. Romeo menyadari\nbahwa ia telah membuat kesalahan besar.\nKemudian Friar Lawrence menyarankan Romeo ke\nperjalanan ke Mantua sampai keadaan dingin. Dia\nberjanji untuk menginformasikan Juliet. Di sisi\nlain, ayah Juliet telah memutuskan waktu baginya\nuntuk menikah dengan Paris. Juliet berkonsultasi\nFriar Lawrence dan membuat sebuah rencana\nuntuk mengambil tidur yang ramuan untuk Juliet\nyang akan mensimulasikan kematian selama tiga\nhari. Plot melanjutkan menurut rencana. Juliet\ntidur dalam kematian. Sayangnya, Surat Friar\ngagal mencapai Romeo. Di bawah sampul\nkegelapan, ia masuk ke makam Juliet. Romeo\nmencium bibir satu Juliet-nya terakhir kali dan\nminum racun. Sementara itu, efek dari tidur yang\nramuan luntur. Juliet bangun menelepon untuk\nRomeo. Dia menemukan <em>cin<\/em>tanya di samping ,\ntapi tergeletak mati, dengan secangkir racun di\ntangannya. Dia mencoba untuk mencium\nmeracuni dari bibirnya, tapi gagal. Kemudian\nJuliet mengeluarkan belati dan terjun itu dalam\ndada'nya. Dia meninggal.",

                        "content": "ini jenis teks nya apa ???<br \/><br \/>These are few cases out of hundreds of similar cases and the number is\u00a0increasing over the time. In Indonesia bullying exists in every form, from teasing to\u00a0extreme abuse. Even though incidents of bullying are common, unfortunately it is\u00a0not seen as a major problem. A recent survey conducted by National Child\u00a0Protection Commission has shown that more than half of bullying incidents go\u00a0unreported due to the fact that it is considered normal in some parts of the\u00a0society. Also the people who get bullied are either unwilling to report it because\u00a0they feel it will \u201cmake a big deal\u201d. Or worse, they are so scared that they don't trust\u00a0a n y o n e a n d d o n o t w a n t t o s h a r e t h e i r p l i g h t w i t h a n y o n e\u00a0(http:\/\/www.asianewsnet.net\/news-34263.html). The issue of bullying has been\u00a0a problem for years but recently it got limelight from news media when few cases\u00a0were reported.\u00a0Bullying affects the children both psychologically and physically. It is\u00a0estimated that hundreds of children miss school every day due to the fear of being\u00a0mistreated by other students and in some extreme cases they choose to home\u00a0school, or in severe circumstances they stop studying altogether\u00a0(http:\/\/www.bullyingstatistics.org\/content\/facts-on-bullying.html).Children should not be living in constant fear. They shouldn't be afraid. On\u00a0the contrary, they should look forward to every day of school and enjoy school life.\u00a0According to a research bullying has always existed in Indonesian society, but it\u00a0has come to surface due to the recent proliferation of media technologies (Craig,\u00a02009). Since bullying is prevalent in our society it is important that everyone\u00a0should be made aware of this social evil. There should be campaigns to increase\u00a0awareness. Everyone should be working together, against it, to stop it. It is\u00a0distressing to see our children being isolated from society because they are\u00a0treated badly. I am of opinion that no one has any right to harass or make people\u00a0feel inferior. No one should have that kind of power. These children are our future\u00a0and we should make every possible effort to stop bullying.I would like to point out that bullying is everyone's problem and\u00a0responsibility. If you condone bullying in any way, shape or form it means you are\u00a0taking part in it whether it is directly or indirectly by being silent. Majority of\u00a0people agree that we have to work together towards eliminating this problem.\u00a0Some people may consider taunting someone as funny, even though it is\u00a0anything but funny to the person who is at the receiving end. Minor taunts can\u00a0create a lot of pain and suffering. While it may seem innocent but the cumulative\u00a0effect could be highly damaging.                         "content": "I got another barber that comes over from Carterville and helps me  to work on  Saturdays, but the rest of the time I can get along all right alone. You can see for yourself that this is not  New York: City and besides that,  most of the boys works all day and don't have time  to drop in here and get themselves prettied up.<br \/><br \/>\nYou're a newcomer, aren't you? I thought I hadn't seen you around before. I hope you will like it good enough to stay. As I say, this place is not New York City or Chicago, but we have pretty good times. Not as good, though, since Jim Kendall got killed. When he was alive, he and Hod Meyers used to keep this town in an uproar. I bet there was more laughing done here than any other town its size in America.<br \/><br \/>\nJim was comical, and Hod was pretty near a match for him. Since Jim's gone, Hod tries to hold his end up just the same as ever, but it's tough going  when you haven't  got nobody to  work with.<br \/><br \/>\nThere used to be plenty fun in here on Saturdays. This place is jam packed on Saturdays, from four o'clock on. Jim and Hod would show up right after their suppers around six o'clock. Jim would set himself down in that big chair, nearest the blue spittoon.  <br \/><br \/><br \/>\nYou'd thought it was a reserved seat like they have sometimes in a theatre. Hod would generally always stand or walk up and down on some Saturdays, of course, he'd be sitting in this chair part of the time, to get a haircut.<br \/><br \/>\nWell, Jim would sit there a while without opening his mouth then only to spit,  and  finally he'd say to me, \"Whitey,\"--my right name, that is, my right first name, is Dick, but everybody round here calls me Whitey--Jim would say, \"Whitey, your nose looks like a rosebud tonight. You must  been drinking' some of your au de cologne.\"<br \/><br \/>\nSo I'd say, \"No, Jim, but you look like you'd been drinking something of that kind or something worse.\"<br \/><br \/>\nJim would have to laugh at that, but then he'd speak up and say, \"No, I  don't have anything to drink, but I did not say that I wouldn' t  like something'. I wouldn't even mind if it was wood alcohol.\"<br \/><br \/>\nThen Hod Meyers would say, \"Neither would your wife.\" That would set everybody to laugh because Jim and his wife wasn't on very good terms. She'd  divorced him if only there was a chance to get alimony because she didn't have any other  way to take care of herself and the kids. She could never understand Jim. He was kind of rough, but a good fella at heart.<br \/><br \/><br \/>\nBerapakah kecepatan Anda membaca kata per menit?<br \/><br \/>\nUntuk mengetahui tingkat kecepatan Anda dalam membaca gunakan rumus tapi kecepatan Anda dalam membaca belum teruji jika belum menjawab pertanyaan di bawah ini. You can see for yourself that this is not  New York: City and besides that,  most of the boys works all day and don't have time  to drop in here and get themselves prettied up.\nYou're a newcomer, aren't you? I thought I hadn't seen you around before. I hope you will like it good enough to stay. As I say, this place is not New York City or <em>Chic<\/em>ago, but we have pretty good times. Not as good, though, since Jim Kendall got killed. When he was alive, he and Hod Meyers used to keep this town in an uproar. I bet there was more laughing done here than any other town its size in America.\nJim was comical, and Hod was pretty near a match for him. Since Jim's gone, Hod tries to hold his end up just the same as ever, but it's tough going  when you haven't  got nobody to  work with.\nThere used to be plenty fun in here on Saturdays. This place is jam packed on Saturdays, from four <em>o<\/em>'clock on. Jim and Hod would show up right after their suppers around six <em>o<\/em>'clock. Jim would set himself down in that big chair, nearest the blue spittoon.  \nYou'd thought it was a reserved seat like they have sometimes in a theatre. Hod would generally always stand or walk up and down on some Saturdays, of course, he'd be sitting in this chair part of the time, to get a haircut.\nWell, Jim would sit there a while without opening his mouth then only to spit,  and  finally he'd say to me, \"Whitey,\"--my right name, that is, my right first name, is Dick, but everybody round here calls me Whitey--Jim would say, \"Whitey, your nose looks like a rosebud tonight. You must  been drinking' some of your au de cologne.\"\nSo I'd say, \"No, Jim, but you look like you'd been drinking something of that kind or something worse.\"\nJim would have to laugh at that, but then he'd speak up and say, \"No, I  don't have anything to drink, but I did not say that I wouldn' t  like something'. I wouldn't even mind if it was wood alcohol.\"\nThen Hod Meyers would say, \"Neither would your wife.\" That would set everybody to laugh because Jim and his wife wasn't on very good terms. She'd  divorced him if only there was a chance to get alimony because she didn't have any other  way to take care of herself and the kids. She could never understand Jim. He was kind of rough, but a good fella at heart.\nBerapakah kecepatan Anda membaca kata per menit?\nUntuk mengetahui tingkat kecepatan Anda dalam membaca gunakan rumus tapi kecepatan Anda dalam membaca belum teruji jika belum menjawab pertanyaan di bawah ini. been entering<br \/>\n7. raihan........the nasyid very well in his friend's wedding party last week<br \/>\na. was singing<br \/>\nb. is singing<br \/>\nc. has sung<br \/>\nd. had sung<br \/>\ne. have been arriving<br \/>\nd. will arrive<br \/>\ne. hav been arriving<br \/>\n13. the bus came after I......for about twenty minutes.<br \/>\na. have been waiting<br \/>\nb. have waited<br \/>\nc. am waiting<br \/>\nd. had been waiting<br \/>\ne. was waiting <br \/>\n14. when i came in, the dog......under the table<br \/>\na. was sleeping<br \/>\nb. have been sleeping<br \/>\nc. is sleeping<br                         "content": "Teks (Romeo and Juliet)<br \/><br \/>\nRead the following text carefully !<br \/><br \/>\n   In the town of verona there lived two families, the Capulets and the Montageus. They engaged in a bitter feud . Among the Montageus was romeo , a hot-blooded young man with an eye for the ladies. One day, Romeo attended the feast of the Capultes', a costume party where he expected to meet his love, Rosaline, a haughty beauty from a well-to do family. Once there , homever, Romeo's eyes felt upon juliet , and he thought of Rosaline no more .<br \/><br \/>\n  The vision of juliet had been invading his every thought. Unable to sleep , Romeo returned late that night to the juliet's bedroom window. There , he was suprised to find juliet on the balcony, professing her love for him and wishing that he were not a 'Montague' , a name behind his own \"What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smeel as sweet. \" Romeo was ready to deny his name and professed his love . The two agreed at nine o'clock the next morning to be married .<br \/><br \/>\n  Early the next morning, Romeo came to Friar Lawrence begging the friar to marry him to juliet. The friar performed the ceremony , Praying that the union might someday put an end to the feud between the two families . He advised Romeo kept the marriage a secret for a time .<br \/><br \/>\n  On the way home . Romeo chanced upon his friend mercutio arguing with Tybalt , a member of the Capulet clan . That quarrelling last caused Mercutio died . Romeo was reluctant no longer. He drew his word and slew Tybalt died. Romeo realized he had made a terrible mistake. Then Friar Lawrence advised Romeo To travel to mantua until things cool down. He promised to inform juliet .<br \/><br \/>\n In the other hand , Juliet's father had decided the time for her to marry with Paris. Juliet consulted Friar Lawrence and made a plot to take a sleeping poison for juliet which would stimulate death for Three days. The plot proceeded according to the plan. Juliet was sleeping in death.<br \/><br \/>\n Unfortunately , the Fiar's letter failed to reach Romeo. Under the cover of darkness , he broke into Juliet's tomb. Romeo kissed the lips of his juliet one last time and drank the poison. Meanwhile, the effects of the sleeping poison wear off . Juliet woke up calling for Romeo. She found her love next to her but was lying dead , with a cup of poison in his hand . She tried to kiss the poison from his lips , but failed. They engaged in a bitter feud . Among the Montageus was romeo , a hot-blooded young man with an eye for the ladies. One day, Romeo attended the feast of the Capultes', a costume party where he expected to meet his love, Rosaline, a haughty beauty from a well-to do family. Once there , homever, Romeo's eyes felt upon juliet , and he thought of Rosaline no more .\n  The vision of juliet had been invading his every thought. Unable to sleep , Romeo returned late that night to the juliet's bedroom window. There , he was suprised to find juliet on the balcony, professing her love for him and wishing that he were not a 'Montague' , a name behind his own \"What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smeel as sweet. \" Romeo was ready to deny his name and professed his love . The two agreed at nine <em>o<\/em>'clock the next morning to be married .\n  Early the next morning, Romeo came to Friar Lawrence begging the friar to marry him to juliet. The friar performed the ceremony , Praying that the union might someday put an end to the feud between the two families . He advised Romeo kept the marriage a secret for a time .\n  On the way home . Romeo <em>chan<\/em>ced upon his friend mercutio arguing with Tybalt , a member of the Capulet clan . That quarrelling last caused Mercutio died . Romeo was reluctant no longer. He drew his word and slew Tybalt died. Romeo realized he had made a terrible mistake. Then Friar Lawrence advised Romeo To travel to mantua until things cool down. He promised to inform juliet .\n In the other hand , Juliet's father had decided the time for her to marry with Paris. Juliet consulted Friar Lawrence and made a plot to take a sleeping poison for juliet which would stimulate death for Three days. The plot proceeded according to the plan. Juliet was sleeping in death.\n Unfortunately , the Fiar's letter failed to reach Romeo. Under the cover of darkness , he broke into Juliet's tomb. Romeo kissed the lips of his juliet one last time and drank the poison. Meanwhile, the effects of the sleeping poison wear off . Juliet woke up calling for Romeo. She found her love next to her but was lying dead , with a cup of poison in his hand . She tried to kiss the poison from his lips , but failed. One day, as he sat in his boat with his rod, looking at the sparkling waves and watching his line, all of a sudden his float was dragged away deep into the water. This will feed us for days.\u201d Much to his surprise, the fish started to talk and said,\u201dPray, let me live! I am not real fish; I am an enchanted prince.                         "content": "Tolong di terjemahkan<br \/><br \/>Grammar Stage<br \/>\nUsing the word Let to introduce imperatives<br \/>\nLet can be used to introduce suggestions and orders, when these are not addressed to the hearer\/reader (or not only to the hearer\/reader). This structure can be considered a kind of imperative.<br \/>\nPattern Let + Object + Verb 1<br \/>\nWe can use let us (formal) or let\u2019s (informal) to make suggestions or to give orders to a group that includes the speaker.<br \/>\nLet us pray.<br \/>\nLet\u2019s have a drink<br \/>\nOK, let\u2019s all get moving.<br \/>\nShall we?  is used as a questions tag in British English; let\u2019s is used as a short answer.<br \/>\n\u201cLet\u2019s go for a walk, shall we?\u201d \u201cYes, let\u2019s\u201d<br \/>\nThere are two possible negatives, with let us not and do not let us (informal let\u2019s not\/don\u2019s let\u2019s).<br \/>\nLet us not despair. (formal)<br \/>\nLet\u2019s us not get angry. (informal)<br \/>\nDo not let us forget those who came before us. (formal)<br \/>\nDon\u2019t let\u2019s stay up too late toninght. (informal)<br \/>\nForms with don\u2019t, let\u2019s (and let\u2019s, don\u2019t in american english) are very informal.<br \/>\nLet me is used to \u2018give instructions to oneself\u2019 ; the expressions<br \/>\nLet me see and Let me think are very common.<br \/>\neg.   \u201cwhat time do you want to have breakfast?\u201d \u201cLet me think. Yes, I reckon eight o\u2019clock will be early enough.\u201d<br \/>\nNow what\u2019s the best way to get to manchester?<br \/>\nLet me see- suppose I take the m6 from birmingham...<br \/>\nLet me just get my coan and I\u2019ll be with you.<br \/>\nIn a very informal style, let\u2019s is often to mean let me.<br \/>\nLet\u2019s see. Suppose I the m6 from birmingham..<br \/>\nLet can also introduce a suggestion or order for someone or something else, not the speaker or hearer. This is common in formal and ceremonial language, but informal uses are also possible.<br \/>\neg. Let the prayers begin.<br \/>\nLet our enemies understand that we will not hesitate to defend our territory and our interests, wherever they may be.<br \/>\n\u201cYour boyfriend\u2019s going out with another girl.\u201d<br \/>\n\u201clet him be. I don\u2019t care.\u201d<br \/>",

                        "highlighted_content": "Tolong di terjemahkanGrammar Stage\nUsing the word Let to introduce imperatives\nLet can be used to introduce suggestions and orders, when these are not addressed to the hearer\/reader (or not only to the hearer\/reader). This structure can be considered a kind of imperative.\nPattern Let + Object + Verb 1\nWe can use let us (formal) or let\u2019s (informal) to make suggestions or to give orders to a group that includes the speaker.\nLet us pray.\nLet\u2019s have a drink\nOK, let\u2019s all get moving.\nShall we?  is used as a questions tag in British English; let\u2019s is used as a short answer.\n\u201cLet\u2019s go for a walk, shall we?\u201d \u201cYes, let\u2019s\u201d\nThere are two possible negatives, with let us not and do not let us (informal let\u2019s not\/don\u2019s let\u2019s).\nLet us not despair. (formal)\nLet\u2019s us not get angry. (informal)\nDo not let us forget those who came before us. (formal)\nDon\u2019t let\u2019s stay up too late toninght. (informal)\nForms with don\u2019t, let\u2019s (and let\u2019s, don\u2019t in american english) are very informal.\nLet me is used to \u2018give instructions to oneself\u2019 ; the expressions\nLet me see and Let me <em>thin<\/em>k are very common.\neg.   \u201cwhat time do you want to have breakfast?\u201d \u201cLet me <em>thin<\/em>k. Yes, I reckon eight <em>o<\/em>\u2019clock will be early enough.\u201d\nNow what\u2019s the best way to get to manchester?\nLet me see- suppose I take the m6 from birmingham...\nLet me just get my coan and I\u2019ll be with you.\nIn a very informal style, let\u2019s is often to mean let me.\nLet\u2019s see. Suppose I the m6 from birmingham..\nLet can also introduce a suggestion or order for someone or something else, not the speaker or hearer. This is common in formal and ceremonial language, but informal uses are also possible.\neg. Let the prayers begin.\nLet our enemies understand that we will not hesitate to defend our territory and our interests, wherever they may be.\n\u201cYour boyfriend\u2019s going out with another girl.\u201d\n\u201clet him be. I don\u2019t care.\u201d",

                            "content": "<span>Grammar Tahap\nMenggunakan kata Mari memperkenalkan imperatif\nBiarkan dapat digunakan untuk memperkenalkan saran dan perintah, ketika ini tidak ditujukan kepada pendengar \/ pembaca (atau tidak hanya untuk pendengar \/ pembaca). Struktur ini dapat dianggap semacam keharusan.\nPola Biarkan + Object + Verb 1\nKita dapat menggunakan mari kita (formal) atau mari (informal) untuk membuat saran atau memberikan perintah untuk kelompok yang mencakup pembicara.\nMari kita berdoa.\nMari minum\nOK, mari kita semua bisa bergerak.\nBolehkah kita? digunakan sebagai tag pertanyaan di British bahasa Inggris; mari kita digunakan sebagai jawaban singkat.\n\"Mari kita pergi untuk berjalan-jalan, akan kita?\" \"Ya, mari kita\"\nAda dua kemungkinan negatif, dengan janganlah kita dan jangan sampai kita (tidak resmi jangan \/ let don ini ini).\nMari kita putus asa. (resmi)\nMari Ini kita tidak marah. (Informal)\nJangan sampai kita melupakan mereka yang datang sebelum kita. (resmi)\nJangan mari tidur terlalu larut toninght. (Informal)\nBentuk dengan tidak, mari kita (dan mari kita, tidak dalam bahasa Inggris Amerika) sangat informal.\nMari saya digunakan untuk 'memberikan instruksi kepada diri sendiri'; ekspresi\nBiarkan saya melihat dan membiarkan saya pikir sangat umum.\nmisalnya. \"Apa waktu yang Anda inginkan untuk sarapan?\" \"Biarkan aku berpikir. Ya, saya rasa pukul delapan akan cukup awal. \"\nSekarang apa cara terbaik untuk mendapatkan ke manchester?\nMari saya lihat-kira saya mengambil m6 dari birmingham ...\nMari saya hanya mendapatkan Coan saya dan saya akan dengan Anda.\nDalam gaya sangat informal, mari kita seringkali berarti membiarkan saya.\nAyo lihat. Misalkan saya yang m6 dari birmingham ..\nLet juga dapat memperkenalkan saran atau perintah seseorang atau sesuatu yang lain, bukan pembicara atau pendengar. Hal ini biasa terjadi dalam bahasa formal dan seremonial, namun penggunaan informal juga mungkin.\nmisalnya. Biarkan doa dimulai.\nBiarkan musuh kita memahami bahwa kita tidak akan ragu untuk mempertahankan wilayah kita dan kepentingan kita, di manapun mereka berada.\n\"Pacarmu akan keluar dengan gadis lain.\"\n\"Biarkan dia menj<\/span>",

                            "content": "Tata panggung\n<br \/>Menggunakan kata biarkan untuk memperkenalkan imperatif\n<br \/>Biarkan dapat digunakan untuk memperkenalkan saran dan pesanan, saat ini tidak ditujukan untuk pembaca\/pendengar (atau tidak hanya untuk pembaca\/pendengar). Struktur ini dapat dianggap semacam keharusan.\n<br \/>Biarkan pola + objek + kata 1\n<br \/>Kita dapat menggunakan Mari kita (formal) atau Mari kita (informal) untuk membuat saran atau memberi perintah kepada kelompok yang mencakup pembicara.\n<br \/>Mari kita berdoa.\n<br \/>Mari kita minum-minum\n<br \/>OK, mari kita semua bergerak.\n<br \/>Akan kita? digunakan sebagai tag pertanyaan di Inggris; Mari kita digunakan sebagai jawaban pendek.\n<br \/>\"Mari kita pergi berjalan-jalan, akan kita?\" \"Ya, mari kita\"\n<br \/>Ada dua kemungkinan negatif, dengan janganlah kita dan jangan biarkan kami (Mari kita tidak don's Mari kita informal).\n<br \/>Mari kita putus asa. (formal)\n<br \/>Mari kita tidak mendapatkan marah. (informal)\n<br \/>Mari kita lupa orang-orang yang datang sebelum kami. (formal)\n<br \/>Mari kita tidak tetap up toninght terlambat. (informal)\n<br \/>Bentuk dengan tidak, mari kita (dan mari kita, tidak dalam bahasa Inggris Amerika) sangat informal.\n<br \/>Biarkan saya digunakan untuk 'memberikan petunjuk untuk diri sendiri'; ekspresi\n<br \/>Biarkan aku melihat dan membiarkan saya berpikir sangat umum.\n<br \/>misalnya. \"apa waktu Apakah Anda ingin untuk sarapan?\" \"Biarkan aku berpikir. Ya, saya rasa pukul delapan akan cukup awal.\"\n<br \/>Sekarang apa adalah cara terbaik untuk mendapatkan ke manchester?\n<br \/>Izinkan saya lihat - misalnya, aku mengambil m6 dari birmingham...\n<br \/>Mari saya hanya mendapatkan coan saya dan saya akan dengan Anda.\n<br \/>Gaya sangat informal, mari kita ini sering berarti membiarkan saya.\n<br \/>Mari kita lihat. Kira saya m6 dari birmingham.\n<br \/>Biarkan juga dapat memperkenalkan sebuah saran atau untuk seseorang atau sesuatu yang lain, tidak pembicara atau pendengar. Hal ini umum dalam bahasa formal dan seremonial, tetapi menggunakan informal juga tersedia.\n<br \/>misalnya. Biarkan doa-doa yang mulai.\n<br \/>Biarkan musuh-musuh kita memahami bahwa kita tidak akan ragu untuk mempertahankan wilayah kita dan kepentingan kita, di mana pun mereka mungkin.\n<br \/>\"Pacar Anda akan dengan gadis lain.\"\n<br \/>\"biarkan dia.
